author: Garima Singh
title: Bengaluru: IMD issues yellow alert for rain, several flights delayed; waterlogging troubles commuters | Bengaluru News - News9live
text: Bengaluru: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert for Berngaluru in view of heavy rain in the city. Torrential rains are lashing the city for past couple of days leading to waterlogging and tree felling. This led to severe traffic jams in several parts of the city. The IMD has predicted heavy rain, thunderstorms, and lightning in the city on Friday. Bengaluru residents took a sigh of relief due to the rains as it brought down the scorching temperatures after witnessing a parched April. However, they also expressed their dissatisfaction over authorities preparedness for rains as waterlogging caused inconvenience in daily commute. A Koramangala resident said that the city witnessed scorching heat in April like never before. “We never had to use an air conditioner here before, but this time, we did. I am so glad the famous Bangalore weather is back with the rain lashing the city,” he said. Bengaluru Weather Forecast: IMD issues yellow alert The IMD has predicted a yellow alert for Bengaluru in view of week-long rains. The met department has forecast cloudy sky with spells of rain or thundershowers for today and 2-3 coming days in the city. The minimum and maximum temperature is likely to hover around 24 and 35 degrees Celsius respectively. The weather agency has also asked city residents to be prepared for heavy rain while stepping out of the house. Bengaluru rain: Trees uprooted, roads waterlogged Heavy rain and gusty winds of Wednesday and Thursday have led to severe waterlogging in several key areas of the city. Meanwhile, 152 trees were uprooted on Wednesday and 70 on Thursday due to rain accompanied with gusty winds. This led to traffic jams causing inconvenience for commuters. Taking to micro-blogging site X, the Bengaluru Traffic Police informed the commuters about the waterlogging and traffic jams in parts of the city. The areas are witnessing waterlogged roads are - Windsor Manor towards Old Highground Junction, BEL Circle towards Hebbal, Anil Kumble Circle towards BRV Junction, and Outer Ring Road from Pantarapalya towards Nayandahalli, Airport Road from Chalukya Circle to Hebbal Flyover, Nayandahalli Junction, at Sumanahalli Junction, and along the Outer Ring Road from Hebbal to Gorguntepalya to Nayandahalli. Bengaluru weather: Flights delayed Heavy rainfall on Thursday night and prediction for more heavy downpour has disrupted flight services in Bengaluru, said officials at the Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) on Friday. Several domestic and international flights were diverted. A Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL) official said, "Heavy rainfall accompanied by strong winds rendered the airport inaccessible for landing between 9.35 pm and 10.29 pm, leading to diversion of flights." He added that 13 domestic flights, three international passenger flights, and one international cargo flight were diverted to Chennai on Thursday.
